job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: I love PHC's mission. The people I work with are committed to the mission and values of the organization; they care about our patients and clients and enjoy the people they work with.

review_title: Constant delay in services, underpaid employees
pros: It is a good company to use as a starting stepping stone only.
cons: Underpaid, non-competitive pay, high turnover due to overworking underpaid employees. Executives care only about numbers and do not care about patient satisfaction or employees.

job_title: Prevention Specialist in Des Moines, IA

pros:
Great fringe benefits (health care, PTO)

Organization provides essential social and health care services in the community.

Met some wonderful people here who are very passionate about their work and communities.
cons:
Toxic work environment in administration department (can't speak to other business units):
- Senior leadership is inexperienced
- Lack of authenticity and integrity from leaders
- Poor culture
- Listening is passive 
- Too much focus on output, not enough focus on employees
- Lack of transparency and poor communication from the top down
- Inexperienced HR leaders, staff feedback is used against them
- Organization takes on too much and stretches employees thin 
- Organization furloughed and laid off employees in 2020, matter in which this was done lacked empathy and was unprofessional
- Organization unable to go through needed structural change unless senior leadership changes 
- Decision making is top down only
- Awkward and uncomfortable environment in administration office

pros: Flexible hours Great culture Family oriented
cons:
Not much professional growth
Not the best benefits

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: Patient centered and great benefits. Very evident the staff are mission driven.
cons:
Inexperienced leadership throughout. 
Some senior leaders took credit for the work others completed.
Leaders were not consistent how they reviewed employees skill sets for individual growth.
Took on too many projects that sometimes caused confusion, reactive versus proactive.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Marshalltown, IA
pros: Very positive work environment at the Marshalltown Medical clinic.  Wonderful learning opportunities working side by side with physicians every day.  Work life balance due to no mandating, holidays, or weekends.  Most importantly, you can feel good about the work you do every day.  PHC does so much more for the community than your typical doctor's office.

review_title: Corporate Culture is just a phrase
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros:
- Advancement is guaranteed if you show initiative
- Flexible work environment for some positions
cons:
- Toxic corporate culture is routinely addressed, but seems to be lip service
- Some managers actually compete with their staff
- Staff dissatisfaction is rampant, turnover/burnout is high, retention is not a priority

review_title: Unqualified leadership is destroying this organization.
pros: They provide access to healthcare services to members of our communities who would otherwise not have access.
cons:
East side clinic: There is a problem with nepotism and favoritism that has not been addressed even though it has caused the majority of their recent turnover in the medical staff, nursing staff and interpreter staff. 

There is an issue with  personal relationships that the administration of the clinic keep with their subordinates which make it so that opportunities for promotion are given only to those who are personally close to management. 

This issue has been escalated to upper management but no changes are taking place. 

The clinic is constantly undergoing role changes with little to no notice given to employees. Most recently, massive changes have been made to job descriptions that make non-medical staff have to take on medical staff functions like taking the vital signs of the patients. 

No formal training or education or qualifications were obtained by the people performing these duties. 


The organization is top heavy. There is a focus in hiring providers, but not hiring enough support staff to take on the increasing amount of tasks that come with caring for more patients. There is rampant burnout that plagues this organization and there is no sign of the administration wanting to address it. 

There is a culture of being talked down to by the administration that has been allowed to grow. There is a focus on pointing out the negatives, while ignoring the positives. Additionally, public reprimands are the norm and lead to humiliation of staff members in front of their peers.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: The people I work with are wonderful.  It's such a rewarding job, and allows me flexibility and the opportunity to feel like I'm making a difference.
cons: There are multiple locations, so I don't get a chance to know everyone.

job_title: Health Benefits Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: Help people who does not have insurance.
cons: Bad management and they won't accept their flaws and want perfections.  Which it does not exist in real life.   100 % accuracy is not realistic.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Des Moines, IA
pros: Assist insured and uninsured no questions asked!!
PTO benefits, healthcare insurance, dental insurance, good for in-between jobs, enjoy helping the underserved who appreciate you, feel good going to work and helping others.
cons: Overworked, underpaid, high turnover, poor communication, lack of direction
